channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Is AI more appealing than crypto now? A major Bitcoin miner has decided to pivot to AI data centers - here's why
item.description: Bitfarm plans to abandon Bitcoin mining for AI data centers using existing energy capacity despite major losses and volatile markets.

item.title: Google Exec Claims Company Needs to Double Its AI Serving Capacity ‘Every Six Months’: Report
item.description: The tech giant has made it known that it wants to grow its AI business by leaps and bounds.

item.title: Nothing’s Android 16 update puts a progress bar on the back of your phone
item.description: Nothing’s Android 16-powered update brings a bunch of new features to its phones, including its own spin on Google’s Live Updates. With Nothing OS 4.0, users can track a delivery, ride, or timer by glancing using the Glyph Interface — the dot-matrix on the Phone 3’s rear, or the system of lights on the Phone […]

item.title: The Writer of ‘Wicked For Good’ Has the Perfect Hook for a Third Movie
item.description: Dana Fox, who co-wrote the 'Wizard of Oz'-inspired musical adaptation, has a specific line in mind if the story were to continue.

item.title: SpaceX’s Next-Gen Starship Booster Explodes During Test
item.description: SpaceX is prepping Starship V3 for the rocket's first orbital flight in 2026.

item.title: In Kirby Air Riders, expression is more fun than racing
item.description: Hear me out: Kirby Air Riders isn't a racing game, it's an art tool with a racing game tacked on. The game, out now for the Nintendo Switch 2, is the follow-up to the quirky Kirby-flavored kart racer released in 2003 on the GameCube. It features Smash Bros. creator Masahiro Sakurai's round, pink, utterly charming […]

item.title: Eli Lilly becomes first health-care company to hit $1 trillion
item.description: Zepbound and Mounjaro posted triple-digit revenue growth, making Lilly the first health-care firm to reach a trillion-dollar valuation. Silicon Valley’s giants crowd the list of the world’s most valuable companies, but drugmaker Eli Lilly is hot on their heels. The company topped a market capitalization of one trillion dollars on Friday, becoming the first business in the health industry to hit that milestone....

item.title: The hottest AI wearables and gadgets you can buy right now
item.description: We compiled all the hottest AI wearables currently available, including Bee, Friend, Plaud, and more.

item.title: The best laptops you can get
item.description: Editor’s note: Black Friday doesn’t officially take place until Friday, November 28th; however, if you want to shop ahead of time, we’ve rounded up the best early Black Friday deals you can already get. Buying the right laptop can be stressful. It’s likely one of the bigger tech purchases you’ll make, and there are a ludicrous number of […]

item.title: DOGE Laid Off the Humans. Now the IRS Is Deploying AI Agents
item.description: Get ready for a bot to hallucinate your tax bill.

item.title: Gen Z is ghosting dating apps: Could AI win them back?
item.description: With ‘swiping fatigue’ on the rise, platforms like Tinder and Bumble are feeling pressure to engage a generation that’s longing for app-free connections. I think back to freshman year, when my friends and I would cram onto a lumpy dorm-issue twin bed and huddle around one phone, collectively cringing as we swiped through Hinge.

item.title: MediaWorld Accidentally Sold iPads for €15 and Asked for Them Back: "It Was a Clear Mistake"
item.description: The advantageous offer appeared to loyalty card holders of the European electronics chain on November 8. After 11 days, the company began contacting those who made purchases, calling it a "clear mistake."

item.description: Shop the best early Black Friday Samsung deals include The Frame TV, Galaxy Watch 8, Galaxy S25 Ultra, Galaxy Tab S11, and more.

item.title: Pranksters Recreated a Working Version of Jeffrey Epstein’s Gmail Inbox
item.description: Using Jmail, you can read thousands of Jeffrey Epstein’s emails in a familiar format. Use the star function to highlight notable finds.

item.title: Doorbuster deal: Sony XM4 headphones are just $159.99 if you hurry
item.description: The legendary Sony WH-1000XM4 noise-canceling headphones are down to just $159.99 at Best Buy for Black Friday.

item.title: ‘Remove the Regime’: November 22 protests call for Trump impeachment in Washington, D.C. Here’s what to know
item.description: Saturday’s rally also demands an end to the deployment of National Guard troops in D.C., amid a record-setting year for anti-Trump administration activism. This weekend, “Remove the Regime” protests in the capital are demanding an end to the Trump administration’s deployment of National Guard troops in Washington, D.C., as well as President Donald Trump’s impeachment, calling the deployment an overreach of presidential powers and politically motivated....

item.title: James Cameron Films, Ranked
item.description: With Cameron's 10th movie, 'Avatar: Fire and Ash', a month away, we put previous work like 'Aliens' and 'Titanic' to the test.

item.title: Linus Torvalds gives approval to "vibe coding" - just don't use it on anything important
item.description: Linux godfather supports vibe coding for learning while rejecting its use in critical kernel development due to maintenance and quality concerns.

item.title: Press a button and this SSD will self-destruct with all your data
item.description: TeamGroup has announced a new portable SSD drive called the T-Create Expert P35S that could give you some peace of mind if you’re worried about your data falling into the wrong hands. Instead of using encryption to lock everything behind a password or biometric security, the P35S has a single button that initiates a self-destruct. […]

item.title: Google Gemini 3 has dropped – here are 6 prompts that show what it can do
item.description: From agentic planning to interactive visual layouts, these prompts show how to tap into Gemini 3’s biggest upgrades.

item.title: Grokipedia sourcing info from the internets biggest neo-Nazi forum, researchers say
item.description: A new non-peer-reviewed analysis of the Wikipedia rival found dozens of references to white nationalist publications.

item.title: CrowdStrike fires ‘suspicious insider’ who passed information to hackers
item.description: Cybersecurity giant CrowdStrike denied it had been hacked following claims from a hacker group, which leaked screenshots from inside CrowdStrike's network.

item.title: Pornhub asked tech platforms to enable device-level age verification
item.description: Pornhub's parent company sent letters to big tech platforms asking for device-level age assurance measures.
